page.title: 01The Block - a description
page.content: The Western half of the Block comprises the Solway Firth; the Eastern half is part of the Cumbrian coast and this is virtually bisected by the River Derwent's Estuary. With the exception of the disused slag bank, south of the estuary, the whole of the area is{just above sea level. The 'Northside' area, once the site of the 'Oldside Iron Works' has been landscaped to provide a recreational area. The populated area of the Block is virtually confined to one grid square in the South-East. In this area of Workington are the{oldest residences. In an area of{high unemployment}the main employers are the engineering works, the dock and the industrial estate. A major{reclamation scheme}is being undertaken to improve the area.
